reviewText: I remembered watching this on PBS a few years ago, and wanting to own a copy.  This film always manages to ignite within me a sense of limitless joy and unbounded opportunity to follow my own voice and leave the common behind.  One day soon, I will.  For now however, this film will keep the embers of my dreams from dying out completely.
Good read but no pictures, so I bought their video of a later voyage.  I really enjoyed the Martins.
great family movie  an inspirational movie if you sail with children or plan to do so. my kids loved it too.
NICE MOVIE TO WATCH. NOT MUCH TO BE SAID ABOUT IT EXCEPT IT WILL GET YOU SET ON CHASING YOUR DREAMS.

My husband and I had seen part of this show late one night on PBS.  I knew I wanted to see it all.  Dave and Jaja truly make you feel like anything is possible you just need to follow your heart.  As a mother, I am in awe of the confidence it would take to travel the oceans with three small children.  This is a beautiful story of life lived to the fullest!

We love this video.  The Martin Family has been an ispiration to our family.  We can't wait to start some adventures of our own.  Definately reccommended to anyone who is thinking about sailing and sailing with a family!

Have you ever touched an iceberg? Have you ever built your own home on land and on the water? Have you ever born and raised children on different oceans? Have you ever gone contrary to convention, not just in life's small things, but in life's big choices? Dave and Jaja Martin have done all of this--and much, much more. For more on their voyage you can read... Into the Light: A Family's Epic Journey
